title: Emergency Department-Initiated Buprenorphine for Opioid Use Disorder (EMBED)
description: Assesses OUD, opioid withdrawal severity, and readiness for ED-initiated buprenorphine treatment using DSM-5 criteria, COWS scale, and treatment readiness assessment.

parameters.name: opioid_larger_amounts
parameters.description: Taking opioids in larger amounts or for longer than intended?

parameters.name: unsuccessful_cut_down
parameters.description: Persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to cut down or control opioid use?

parameters.name: time_obtaining_using
parameters.description: Spending a lot of time obtaining, using, or recovering from opioid effects?

parameters.name: craving_desire
parameters.description: Craving or strong desire to use opioids?

parameters.name: failure_obligations
parameters.description: Failure to fulfill major obligations at work, school, or home due to opioid use?

parameters.name: continued_despite_problems
parameters.description: Continued opioid use despite persistent social or interpersonal problems?

parameters.name: activities_given_up
parameters.description: Important social, occupational, or recreational activities given up or reduced due to opioid use?

parameters.name: hazardous_situations
parameters.description: Recurrent opioid use in physically hazardous situations?

parameters.name: physical_psychological_problems
parameters.description: Continued opioid use despite physical or psychological problems caused or worsened by opioids?

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.description: Tolerance (need for increased amounts or diminished effect with same amount)?

parameters.name: withdrawal
parameters.description: Withdrawal syndrome or using opioids to avoid withdrawal symptoms?

parameters.name: cows_score
parameters.description: Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS) score (0-48 points)

parameters.name: treatment_readiness
parameters.description: Patient readiness for treatment (assessed via brief negotiation interview)

parameters.name: buprenorphine_waiver
parameters.description: Does provider have buprenorphine prescription waiver/certification?

result.name: embed_result
result.description: EMBED assessment result and buprenorphine initiation recommendation

ranges.interpretation: Patient does not meet criteria for ED-initiated buprenorphine treatment. Consider alternative treatment options, referral to addiction medicine, or reassessment when circumstances change.

Patient meets criteria for buprenorphine treatment but withdrawal severity (COWS ≤12) or insufficient time since last opioid use indicates home induction protocol. Provide patient education, prescription for home induction, and follow-up arrangements.

Patient meets all criteria for ED-initiated buprenorphine induction. COWS >12 indicates moderate to severe withdrawal suitable for immediate induction. Proceed with ED induction protocol and arrange follow-up care.

references: D'Onofrio G, Chawarski MC, O'Connor PG, Pantalon MV, Busch SH, Owens PH, et al. Emergency department-initiated buprenorphine for opioid dependence with continuation in primary care: outcomes during and after intervention. J Gen Intern Med. 2017 Jun;32(6):660-666. doi: 10.1007/s11606-017-3993-2.

Hawk K, D'Onofrio G, Chawarski MC, O'Connor PG, Cowan E, Lyons MS, et al. Barriers and facilitators to clinician readiness to provide emergency department-initiated buprenorphine. JAMA Netw Open. 2020 May 1;3(5):e204561. doi: 10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2020.4561.
American Psychiatric Association. Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders (5th ed.). Arlington, VA: American Psychiatric Publishing; 2013.
Wesson DR, Ling W. The Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS). J Psychoactive Drugs. 2003 Apr-Jun;35(2):253-9. doi: 10.1080/02791072.2003.10400007.
formula: DSM-5 OUD diagnosis (≥2 criteria) + COWS assessment + Treatment readiness + Clinical factors → Treatment recommendation
notes: DSM-5 OUD severity: Mild (2-3 criteria), Moderate (4-5 criteria), Severe (≥6 criteria)
COWS interpretation: <8 (None to Mild), 8-12 (Mild to Moderate), >12 (Moderate to Severe)
ED induction recommended for COWS >12 and sufficient time since last opioid use
Home induction recommended for COWS ≤12 or insufficient time since last opioid use
Tolerance and withdrawal criteria not met if opioids taken under appropriate medical supervision
Pregnancy requires specialized consultation and modified treatment approach
Provider must have appropriate buprenorphine waiver/certification
Risk of precipitated withdrawal decreased with COWS >12
Follow evidence-based protocols for safe buprenorphine induction
Arrange appropriate follow-up care and addiction treatment referral
